p: Ajoene, one of the organosulphur compounds in garlic, may inhibit HIV via inhibiting integrin-dependent processes, thereby blocking viral adhesion to host cells ( Rouf et al., 2020). Furthermore, lectin, a non-sulphur containing compound in garlic, has been reported to inhibit viral attachment in SARS-CoV ( Keyaerts et al, 2007). In addition, flavonoids in garlic have a strong inhibitory effect on virus multiplication, as they have been reported to block formation of viral proteins and genetic material ( Zandi et al., 2011). Moreover, quercetin prevents viral entry and inhibits replication ( Mousa, 2017), thereby minimizing viral infectivity. Quercetin interacts with haemagglutinin proteins, glycoproteins which helps viruses attach and fuse with host cells, thereby inhibiting entry of viruses into host cells. Quercetin is also able to increase zinc (Zn) uptake, a mineral which inhibits the activity of RNA polymerase, thereby preventing viral replication (Sreenivasulu et al., 2020). In addition, quercetin inhibits translation of hepatitis C ( Gonzalez et al., 2009) and the main protease of SARS-CoV ( Sharma, 2019).
